text: they're a group of students planning a
weekend of fun instead they were woken
up by a blast and spent a day under
heavy gunfire hiding under their beds
frightened for their lives ice militants
struck near their dormitory in Kirkuk
priests in Erbil helped him escape but
the girls are too scared to be
identified Jana Jana ssi lenoir-rhyne
Kostov pirated we got a cold we were
told there was going to be a strike in
the building next to ours because I as
militants were there we all gathered in
one room and hid under the beds two
girls under each bed with blankets and
bed sheets so that the shrapnel and
broken glass wouldn't hurt us five
minutes later we heard four or five men
come and they were dash is fighters two
of them were wounded it was dark so we
couldn't see them and they couldn't see
us but we knew they were I as fighters
because they kept talking about Islamic
state they came and sat on our beds they
were making phone calls and asking for
more ammunition tell me what it was like
when you were under that bed with is
fighters sitting on it talking leanna
nuts in a pallet Rob we were all
frightened I was trying not to make any
sound not to breathe even I kept telling
myself stay strong get through this I
just held my friends hands and we kept
praying one of them tells me she could
still hear the wounded ious fighter on
her bed he was groaning in pain she said
his voice is still ringing in my ear
another one told me she felt this was
the end how at the Harbor homie I'm
going to Harvard thought the situation
was so bad I wanted to call my family to
say goodbye and ask forgiveness for any
mistakes of me despite the horrors they
faced the girls say they want to go back
to university in Kirkuk our faith is
strong they say it's stronger than is
shy mahalia BBC News airbill northern
